cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi WNW of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift west-northwest tonight, then turn south on Friday and accelerate, remaining over the east-central Gulf of Mexico well offshore of the U.S. Gulf Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Not expected to make landfall (forecast to remain over open Gulf)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Portions of the northeastern and east-central Gulf of Mexico, primarily offshore areas south of the Florida Panhandle and Alabama.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (â‰¤7%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; prevailing winds generally below gale force for the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; storm remains well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated outer-band showers possible; heavy rainfall focus is over Florida, not Louisiana.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly affect port operations.
